When i heard that there was going to be a new Mariposa film, i could not wait. I loved the first one, even though some aspects of it where questionable, the Skeezites who eat butterfly fairies?! I was shocked to hear Kelly Sheridan voice instead of Chiara Zanni. I liked how Zanni brought a new diminution to a non-Barbie character, however, in this film, Sheridan 's voice makes Mariposa sound like all of the other Barbie characters and brings no depth to this character we have come to love. I have other nit picks about this film as to the hair change, color and style, but i will not go into detail. Another issue i had was the villain of the film. The character was not well thought out and her plan is the same as all of the other Barbie villains. i would have liked to see more of her back story as to why she started off looking one way then changing. Moreover, I do think that this story brings a new look at Barbie films and what she can accomplish because she was not the full focus of the film. Mariposa and Princess Catania shared the spotlight and worked together to save the land. the lesson, over all, was vary strong; showing the viewer that all you need is to take time to get to know and understand each others differences to truly be a friend. Over all i loved the film and it is worth giving it a chance.

My biggest girl says that of all the Barbe movies, this might be, if not the best, really high up on the list of the best Barbie movies. In my view as an adult i can say that it is very good indeed, not only does it deal with issues like kindness and how people's attitude towards you reflects like a mirror your attitude towards them, it is also a good lesson on how to face your fears and not compromising your values just for fear of rejection.
It has always amazed me how people criticizes Barbie in general, but since I am a mother of two girls I have watched my fair share of Barbie movies, and I honestly say that regardless of what you may think of her, in the movies she usually is a problem solver and rarely (if ever) does she depend on  a guy to save her, but on the contrary, you see that the strongest bonds are with her family and friends.

My daughter is 10 & started from day one collecting Barbie movies as they were released. We are not "Barbie people", but absolutely Love & Enjoy watching these movies together. Not a single Male relative (teens/20 somethings) ever complain about 'having' to watch one with her. We received this movie and watched it twice in a row! Something we did Not do with Pink Shoes or Pearl Princess. I thought we may be 'growing out' of them, but this one brought laughs and enjoyment & another lesson learned. Throughout the movie I kept pointing out myself, the lesson, thinking they totally dropped the ball, but proved me wrong in the end. Add this one to your Barbie collection.

Mariposa is back! This time as the Royal Ambassador of Flutterfield sent to bring friendship to rival kingdom Shimmervale. Here, despite her best efforts, she is greeted with antipathy and suspicion by its residents and King. This is only made worse when Mariposa's wings (made bigger and better in her first movie adventure) become a liability; clumsily knocking over the king's tea and turning her chilly welcome into a rather hot one. But when her mission of peace seems destined to fail, she is befriended by Princess Catiana, the one voice of reason in a kingdom overrun by paranoia and distorted perceptions over the Butterfly Fairies of Flutterfield. Together, these fairy princesses work against all odds to promote peace and understanding.
Looming in the background, the real threat; a terrible dark fairy, threatens to undo Shimmervale by turning all their magic glowing crystals, the source of their livelihood, into dark, lifeless stones. This storyline, brought about by the king's refusal to offer her a small crystal years earlier, runs parallel to Mariposa's quest for understanding and illustrates another instance where a little friendship can make a big difference. Here, for the gift of a single crystal to a stranger, the king could have made a powerful friend rather than a powerful enemy. It takes Mariposa and Catiana to undo this oversight and restore peace.
This of course doesn't justify the evil deeds of the Dark Fairy or her attempts to destroy Shimmervale because her denied request for a magic crystal years ago. And while she may have gone overboard in the revenge department (without which we wouldn't have a story) it's not a matter of "Give me what I want or else" but the failure of a king to show common courtesy to a stranger with the smallest act of kindness, the kind of gesture that would have made Mariposa feel welcome and at home in a foreign land.
This illustrates the bottom line of the story; fear is bad, friendship is good. Treat a stranger with friendship and, more often than not, it will be returned in kind. Suspicion and hatred, same thing. Barbie's quote at the end of the credits is "The best way to make a friend is to be a friend" and that sums it up to perfection. Friendship is a two-way street and almost everyone responds to kindness.

Come on people, these movies are not amazing. The story lines are stolen and overused. The animation is terrible. The comedy is almost non-existent. And every character looks almost exactly alike. Tall, skinny, flawless. Same eyes, lips, and long hair. I gues that is the flaw with the Barbie industry. Okay, my opinion aside. My daughter loves the Barbie movies. But for some reason, she did not enjoy this one. They are clearly just trying to make mula. I mean seriously? Barbie Mariposa. Barbie and the Fairy secret. Barbie Mariposa and the fairy princess. Let's just combine characters and make a crappy movie that will make us more money. Are they even trying anymore?
